Questions.Question: Who played the iconic character of James Bond in the film 'Goldfinger'?
Questions.Explanation: Sean Connery portrayed the suave and charismatic spy James Bond in the classic film 'Goldfinger' released in 1964.

Questions.Question: Which film won the Academy Award for Best Picture in 1940?
Questions.Explanation: Gone with the Wind, a sweeping epic set during the American Civil War, won the Best Picture Oscar in 1940.

Questions.Question: Who directed the film 'Citizen Kane'?
Questions.Explanation: Orson Welles directed and starred in the groundbreaking film 'Citizen Kane' released in 1941.

Questions.Question: Which actress won the Academy Award for Best Actress for her role in 'Gone with the Wind'?
Questions.Explanation: Vivien Leigh won the Best Actress Oscar for her portrayal of Scarlett O'Hara in 'Gone with the Wind'.

Questions.Question: Who played the iconic character of Dorothy in the film 'The Wizard of Oz'?
Questions.Explanation: Judy Garland enchanted audiences as Dorothy in the timeless classic 'The Wizard of Oz' released in 1939.

Questions.Question: Which film is known for the line 'Here's looking at you, kid'?
Questions.Explanation: The iconic line 'Here's looking at you, kid' is from the film 'Casablanca' released in 1942.

Questions.Question: Who played the iconic character of Holly Golightly in the film 'Breakfast at Tiffany's'?
Questions.Explanation: Audrey Hepburn captivated audiences as Holly Golightly in the classic film 'Breakfast at Tiffany's' released in 1961.

Questions.Question: Which film is known for the line 'I'm king of the world!'?
Questions.Explanation: The famous line 'I'm king of the world!' is from the film 'Titanic' released in 1997.

Questions.Question: Who played the iconic character of Rick Blaine in the film 'Casablanca'?
Questions.Explanation: Humphrey Bogart portrayed the complex character of Rick Blaine in the timeless classic 'Casablanca' released in 1942.

Questions.Question: Which film is known for the line 'May the Force be with you'?
Questions.Explanation: The iconic line 'May the Force be with you' is from the film 'Star Wars' released in 1977.

Questions.Question: Who played the iconic character of Vito Corleone in the film 'The Godfather'?
Questions.Explanation: Marlon Brando delivered a legendary performance as Vito Corleone in the classic film 'The Godfather' released in 1972.

Questions.Question: Which film is known for the line 'Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn'?
Questions.Explanation: The famous line 'Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn' is from the film 'Gone with the Wind' released in 1939.

Questions.Explanation: The iconic line 'I'll be back' is from the film 'The Terminator' released in 1984.
